modules.description: The module offers low-level cryptographic functionalities such as session management, object manipulation, and key operations, working with session and object handles, attributes, byte arrays, and mechanism parameters. It enables use cases like secure token initialization, data encryption/decryption, and key generation through structured workflows involving initialization, update, and finalization steps. Additionally, it supports random number generation and key derivation, leveraging session handles and attribute structures for secure cryptographic service execution.

This module enables low-level interaction with PKCS#11 cryptographic tokens through operations like session management, user authentication, and token information retrieval, utilizing data structures such as CK_TOKEN_INFO and CK_SESSION_INFO. It supports cryptographic workflows including object manipulation, key derivation, and data encryption/decryption, leveraging session handles, mechanism structures, and byte buffers for tasks like signing, digesting, and random number generation. Specific use cases include secure key management, hardware-accelerated cryptographic operations, and staged processing of sensitive data.

Provides functions to interact with cryptographic tokens, including initializing sessions, generating keys, and signing data. Works with types such as session handles, key attributes, and mechanism parameters. Used to securely manage cryptographic operations within HSMs and smart card environments.

Manages cryptographic operations through session and object handles, supporting encryption, decryption, key generation, and random number generation using attribute structures and byte arrays. Provides mechanisms for key derivation and secure token initialization with structured workflow steps. Operations include attribute manipulation, data processing, and mechanism parameter handling. Examples include securely generating keys, encrypting data, and deriving cryptographic material within a session.

Manages cryptographic token interactions via session handles, mechanism structures, and byte buffers, supporting operations such as authentication, key management, and data encryption. It provides access to token and session information through types like CK_TOKEN_INFO and CK_SESSION_INFO, enabling secure, hardware-accelerated cryptographic workflows. Tasks like signing, digesting, and random number generation are facilitated through structured data and session-based execution. Examples include securely storing keys, performing encrypted data transfers, and managing user authentication stages.
